1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 16) (Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2021. 

Covid-19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment – Cessation

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments 
and Control) Regulations to specify dates when payment of the Covid-19 
Pandemic Unemployment Payment will cease, beginning with those whose 
reckonable weekly income (previously calculated in accordance with article 
52I of the consolidated Regulations) is less than €200 per week. 

For those whose average reckonable weekly income is less than €200.00: 

(a) payment of the Covid-19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment will 

cease from 22 October 2021. 

(b) For 

in receipt of 

those who are 

the Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment and any other payment specified in subarticle (2) of article 223F, except for Child Benefit, payment of the 
Covid-19 Pandemic Unemployment Payment will cease on 5 
November 2021. 

For those whose average reckonable weekly income was equal to or greater 
than €200.00 but less than €300.00 will, depending on the circumstances, cease 
to be paid in a like manner to that described in (a) and (b) over the period from 
5 November until 28 January 2022. 

For those whose average reckonable weekly income was equal to or greater 
than €300.00 will, depending on the circumstances, cease to be paid in a like 
manner to that described in (a) and (b) over the period from 28 January 2022 
until 24 March 2022. 

The final date from which no further payments of the Covid-19 Pandemic 
Unemployment Payment will be made, regardless of individual circumstances, 
is set at 25 March 2022.
